Summary: Orange-red object moving silently across sky.
divs: sighting detailsat approximately 10:15 pm, july 4, i was out in my front yard with my dog, when i witnessed in the sky an orange-red object, about 3x to 5x the size of a planet, approaching from the southwest approximately 25 to 35 degrees above the horizon. the size and shape of the object was difficult to judge at night, but the shape of what appeared to be a "single light" was round or spherical. the object maintained a straight line course moving from the southwest to the northeast. when i first observed the object i thought it was an airplane off in the distance approaching our home, but as it got closer and went past my home overhead , i heard no sound and could not see any flashing strobe or navigation lights on the object. as the object approached and receded, the apparent size of the object did not appear to increase or decrease signficantly. the object appeared to be at a constant altitude and moved at a constant\uniform velocity. there was no change in the object's flight path, it moved in a straight line. the total time i observed the object was about 30 to 45 seconds until it disappeared behind some clouds as it moved past and behind my house as it continued to move in a straight line path to the northeast. perhaps the object was a satellite in low earth orbit, but the size of the orange-red light seemed too large to be a satellite 70 to 80 miles above the surface. if the object was a small plane at low altitude, i would have expected to hear engine noise, if the object was a jet aircraft at high altitude, i would have expected the object to have taken longer to traverse the sky, given the high altitude.
